page.title: 10PUBS IN DOGMERSFIELD AREA
page.content: The Black Horse is in Crookham Village. It is owned by Courage. There is a garden at the rear and a large car park.Horse prints and agricultural tools decorate the single bar, which has a juke box. The Queens Head at Dogmersfield is also a Courage pub, both being housed in 17th century buildings.However the decor is more formal, mainly regimental badges and local prints.The evenings at both pubs are busy with customers mainly in their early 20s. The Horns Inn at Crondall is a Phoenix house with a large car park but no beer garden. There are 2 bars, with a dartboard & fruit machine in the public one. The building is quite modern. All of these pubs provide midday meals. The Chequers Inn, Crookham is a free house near the Basingstoke Canal.The cosy bar has prints of 80 years of royalty.
